msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: In epistulas septem catholicas
msItem.rubric: fol. 2r Incipit expositio uenerabilis bede presbiteri in epistula beati iacobi apostoli.
msItem.incipit: Iacobus dei et domini nostri ihesu cristi seruus⸵ duodecim tribubus quę sunt in dispersione salutem. Dixit de hoc iacobo apostolus paulus.
msItem.explicit: fol. 100rb et hoc non ab initio temporis alicuius. sed ante omne seculum. et nunc et in omnia sefol. 100vacula saeculorum amen.
msItem.note: Each of the epistles is treated as a separate work.

collation.formula: a2 (attached to upper pastedown), 1–128, 136, b4 (4 pastedown)
collation.signatures: Gatherings numbered, centred at the foot of the last page, ·i· to ·xii·.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled in drypoint; pricked on the outer edge of the page. On fol. 2r, major horizontal rules occur, from top to bottom, at 24 | 38 | 214 | 227.5 | 279 mm; vertical rules, from left to right, at 18 | 80 | 85.5 | 92 | 153 | 196 mm. Line spacing 6.5 mm.

decoDesc.decoNote: Large decorated Lombardic initials open each letter: fol. 2ra, James, long blue I with intricate blue, red, green, and golden decoration; 28rb, 1 Peter, 6-line red P with blue, green, and golden decoration; 50va, 2 Peter, 7-line golden and blue S with red and green decoration; 65ra, 1 John, 7-line red and blue Q with red, green, and golden decoration; 92vb, 2 John, 7-line red and blue S with golden and dark green decoration; 94ra, 3 John, 6-line golden S with red and blue decoration; 95va, long blue I in the margin with golden decoration. Headings in red (alternating with blue on 2ra).

additions.p: On cover, list of contents by John Prise; Beda (s. xvi).
Pressmarks: 29 (s. xvi, spine); I Arch 3–9 (s. xvii, white label on spine, fol. ir); 2083 = 64 (fol. 1r); 64 (29) (fol. 2r).

binding.p: Romanesque, whittawed leather over oak boards. Extended tabs at head and tail, with blue and white endbands.
binding.condition: Leather deteriorated at the joints, which however allows for close examination of the binding structure.

history.origin: Written at Cirencester Abbey between 1149 and 1176. Fol. ir, Liber sancte Marie De Cirecestr’. D’ Andree Abbatis tempore scriptus per manum D' Fulconis canonici postea prioris. D’ Adam de lamora tunc Cantore. Andrew was abbot 1147–76; Adam was not cantor before 1149.
history.acquisition: Appears in the list of the books of John Prise in the 1602 donation willed to Jesus College by his son Gregory Prise (1535–1600). Neil R. Ker, ‘Sir John Prise’, The Library, 5th ser., 10, no. 1 (March 1955): 1–24.

listBibl.bibl: Andrew G. Watson, Catalogue of Dated and Datable Manuscripts c. 435–1600 in Oxford Libraries (Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1984), no. 803.
